Description: Ostracon, eight fragments (seven of which are joined together to form two large sections) of the body of a red-grey pottery jar with rounded base and flaring lower body, becoming convex at shoulder, the fabric is relatively coarse and contains many small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and many lines of black-painted demotic text, separated on one side by a vertical column comprising black-painted linear representations of birds.
Curator's comments: Being studied for publication by Bryan Kraemer. Thoth 'Great of 5' Group
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393495) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393495)
